children.subject: I know this is subjective, but could you compare the workload of 186 to other classes you've taken? How does it compare to 61b (Hug) or 61c (Garcia)?

It's been a while since I've taken either course (Spring 2018 for Hug 61B, Fall 2018 for Garcia 61C), and the courses may have shifted in workload since I took them (I think the Fall 2019 version of 61C was heavier than the Fall 2018 version), but I would probably say that the projects are at least as heavy as projects you've seen in 61B or 61C, and the 186 projects are definitely heavier by the time you get to the latter half of the course. This is offset by the fact that there are no homework assignments in 186, but I would probably say it's as heavy as 61B/61C in general.
To the TA above, (different anon) how about CS 162 and CS 161 with a breadth course?

As a CS 186 TA, (the current iteration of) CS 186 is not a light class, especially if you don't have a lot of confidence in dealing with project heavy classes (there's almost always a project assigned to you in 186, and they generally get harder as the semester progresses, although there are no homework assignments). I think my advice will be more cautious than most other people, but combining 186 and 162 is not the greatest unless you're really confident you can handle 126 easily and you get a really coordinated group for 162 (a class with even denser projects, with coding homeworks on top). This advice is given with the caveat that the CS 186 is transitioning back to in-person lecture with new professors in the fall, and this may affect the structure of the course, but if there are no significant changes I would be cautious about taking 186 and 162 together if you are not confident in your Java/C or ability to pick new things up very quickly.

agree w/ justin - comparing the difficulty of 188/127/189 and 162/126/186: they should roughly be comparable, but if you do take this combination of classes, please watch out for the shift from a pset-heavy to a project-heavy courseload. 186 has 5 projects and they're definitely not a walk in the park. i do think that some of the material in 162 and 186 complement each other nicely though. 

my personal anecdote is i took 162/186/math 113 together and it turned out okay, but really felt kind of painful haha

history.content:
I'm doing 188/127/189 this semester and finding it pretty manageable (I suppose it's hard to extrapolate from this semester in particular, but I was managing it fine before the covid mess started as well.) Otoh I want to start research in the fall and do some internship recruiting, so I don't want something too much heavier than my current load. I think I'm faster at psets than coding projects, but I also haven't really taken any project-based classes aside from the lower divs.

I'm hoping 126 won't take me too much time because I've taken 134 and generally feel pretty solid on probability. (In retrospect, probably should've just taken 126, but oh well). Not really sure what to expect from the other two classes. Especially curious about 186.

Also, I've considered swapping out 186 for ee120; would that substantially lighten my workload?

Thanks!
history.subject: Thoughts on 162/126/186?
